title: Disconnecting from game constantly after updating to 6.9
body: I keep on disconnecting from game and I cannot move when I reconnect. If anyone knows what the problem is please help.

replies.body: The disconnect issue is really making me sick. I now have a 20-30 minute ban for que dodging, when its not even my fault. Where do i submit screenshots to riot about this issue? They don't have anything setup to help player who just dc due to their server issues? These bans are unfair.

I keep DC'ing from game in champion select. Gave me 30 min ban, I don't think this is fair. Here is my network log from the DC

"2016-05-05T01-25-58: LogOut_File: : logfile started
2016-05-05T01-25-58: Net Status: low-level initialize success.
2016-05-05T01-25-58: Note that this new version (12/19/2011) has reduced the frequency of updates so the numbers will be larger
2016-05-05T01-25-58: time = time of logging
2016-05-05T01-25-58: address = address of IP address
2016-05-05T01-25-58: incoming = total size of messages set to me in bytes. Spikes can indicate lag.
2016-05-05T01-25-58: outgoing = total size of messages set from me in bytes. Spikes can indicate lag.
2016-05-05T01-25-58: app_ctos = client to server bytes delta excluding overheads (app data only)
2016-05-05T01-25-58: app_stoc = server to client bytes delta excluding overheads (app data only)
2016-05-05T01-25-58: loss = number of packets lost. Can indicate lags.  Some node on the network is dropping packets or taking to long and we have to resend them.
2016-05-05T01-25-58: sent = number of packets sent. Spikes can indicate lag.
2016-05-05T01-25-58: ping = how long it takes for a packet to get back and forth. Spikes can indicate lag.
2016-05-05T01-25-58: variance = how much the ping is changing from avg ping. Spikes can indicate lag.
2016-05-05T01-25-58: reliable delayed = This occurs when we drop reliable packets from sending this frame because we are sending to much data. Unreliable are more likely to be dropped than reliable.
2016-05-05T01-25-58: unreliable delayed = This occurs when we drop unreliable packets from sending this frame because we are sending to much data.
2016-05-05T01-25-58: app update delayed = This occurs when the app is taking to long to run code caused by network packets (ie CPU) and packets are delayed until the next frame
2016-05-05T01-25-58: Time spent in critical section (frame) = This is the time the network thread is blocking the main thread from doing anything.
2016-05-05T01-25-58: [time], [address], [incoming], [outgoing], [app_ctos], [app_stoc], [loss], [sent], [ping], [variance], [reliable delayed], [unreliable delayed], [app update delayed], [Time spent in critical section (frame)]

I'm having the exact same problem! Suddenly I'm frozen and trying to reconnect, has cost and almost cost me quite a few games already.
I was too and all the suddenly it was fine? It was very frustrating because it usually never happens to me. I didn't even get a loss prevention from that game.
I too am constantly disconnecting from my games even though I show constant network connection. I have a 30 minute queue time because of this and it has cost me many games.
im constantly dcing from the client and cant even enter a game because of it. :(

I had the same issue just now, and the crazy thing is my roommate and I were in the same game. We both disconnected, and suddenly we could play again. And I got to the 2nd tower on mid and froze, apparently, I could ping, type in chat, try to surrender, but could not play, or see the things that happened. So Chat froze as well. I had to read responses off my roommates screen. It also caused me to run down lane endlessly trying to get me to where I was nonstop. I'd really like a loss prevention on that seeing as that obviously was something out of my control. I guess, I won't play til they fix these issues. It's terrible because we had a chance to comeback, and lost because I couldn't play and kept running to the team.

I have been haveing this problem for over 3 mouth now. I will randomly dc. 
 
its starts by my champ just walking to the last place i clicked and standing there a few sec before attempting to reconnect pops up.

 The only way i have found to get beck into the game is to Alt Tab and troubleshooting the internet. it mite take more than one try sometime.

 It most of the time says default gateways is not available or can not connect to dns 

I have optimized my dns, set up port forwarding, and been on the phone with the people from Comcast about this problem from the start and still 
nothing no change what so ever.

I have updated every card on my ps and my ps4 (case if my friend is over playing my ps4 online is will dc most of the time as well, even tho the ps4 will come reconnect a lot faster and the league client) even uninstalled and reinstalled a few times 

I have been told all kinds of thing about how its not the client its my internet or how i am using it but at this point I think its just league even if my ps4 and Nintendo 3ds will randomly do it as well if someone is playing League at the same time and i know that doesn't make any sense but that is the only thing left to look from my point of view.

I've been having the same issue. Every few minutes my game just stops responding to any input, and I occasionally get an "attempting to reconnect" message. My ping doesn't seem to increase by more than ten although it feels like a 500 ping spike (Had those pre-patch due to router troubles but I fixed it). In addition to my own connection issues, over my past three games there have been six dcs by other players. Considering all of this I can't see it being a client-side issue.
ever since the update I disconnect at least once a game and end up having to rejoin the game cause I get booted out anyone know what I can do to fix this?

Hey everyone,

Seems like everyone are having some issues with staying connected either in the client or in the game.  Let be clear, I am not going to come in here and say that it is your computers fault or your connections fault.  I've looked at North America as a whole, we do not see any widespread issues.  It still could very well be on our end, but we need to start looking at the most common root causes and eliminate them so we can find the true culprit.

The best way to start eliminating the most common root causes is to complete all of the steps in our Connection Issues Article.  If none of these steps seem to resolve the issue, make sure to [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) we can start looking more in-depth at some other more rare root causes.  Our Tech Specialists can investigate 1 one 1 and get to the heart of it.  Make sure to include the following in your ticket:

1) [Network Analysis](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1)

2) [Network Information Log](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq4)

3) [Process List](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3)
I have actually gone through these steps, including using he hextech repair tool, nadda man
I just had several people get dropped from a game along with myself. I got a 10 minute ban thanks to leaverbuster

So I am not one that had this problem, however I was in a game with 3 people DCing and one of them was in discord with me. He had no issues whatsoever in discord, it was only league dropping. My question to you guys is: Do you use AT&T internet?  I remember there was a problem with comcast and league a few years ago.
Same issue here, now is at the point i don't know i want to play ranked any more or not.
